name: flutter
content:
flutter verb
(MOVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to make a series of quick delicate movements up and down or from side to side, or to cause something to do this: Brightly coloured flags were fluttering in the breeze.flutter down Leaves fluttered down onto the path.flutter about Butterflies fluttered about in the sunshine. A white bird poised on a wire and fluttered its wings.

flutter verb
(HEART/STOMACH)
[ I ] If your heart or stomach flutters, you feel slightly uncomfortable because you are excited or nervous: Every time I think about my exams my stomach flutters!
